results.title: Energy everlasting
results.brief_description: Everyone knows that oil won’t last forever. The search for new forms of renewable energy is increasing. This film looks at some of the ways that are being used to explore the options available. In Indonesia and the Phillipines photo voltaics provide electricity for homes. In Sweden, biomass and hydroelectricity play an increasing role, and in other parts of the world, wind and wave power are playing their part. The costs of these systems are as yet untested in a harsh fiscal world but, in the next thirty years, some of these fledgling technologies will come more and more to the fore.

results.title: Energy and agriculture
results.creator_credit: Chris Oliver, Nicholas Alexander and CSIRO
results.brief_description: Suggests ways of cutting down on energy use in agriculture. Shows how technological change and scientific research can expand the man-on-the-land’s role of producing food energy to the production of liquid fuels such as methanol and ethanol.

results.title: Energy
results.creator_credit: Barbara Buce, Arthur G. Evans and Oxford Films (U.S.)
results.brief_description: Explores energy in humans, animals, the elements and the earth. Shows how these kinds of energy are harnessed and how they are used daily in home and industry. Shows that pollution is a result of excessive use and barren devastation is a result of a lack of conservation. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Energetically yours
results.creator_credit: David Hilberman, Walter Lowendahl and Transfilm
results.brief_description: An animated film by Ronald Searle which traces man’s search for sources of energy to help him in his daily life. It tells of our need and use of energy since primitive times - from fire, through coal and oil, to the atom.

results.title: Endotracheal anaesthesia
results.creator_credit: Margaret Thomson, ICI (GB) and Realist Films
results.brief_description: Without a clear airway the administration of a general anaesthetic is impossible. This film shows how endotracheal anaesthesia overcomes this difficulty by intubation of the larynx. The advantages of endotrachael anaesthesia are summarised.
results.description: Without a clear airway the administration of a general anaesthetic is impossible. This film shows how endotracheal anaesthesia overcomes this difficulty by intubation of the larynx. The advantages of endotrachael anaesthesia are summarised.

results.title: Endocrine glands: how they affect you
results.brief_description: Shows the location of endocrine glands in the human body and explains how hormones secreted by these glands affect growth, metabolism, sexual development, and behaviour. Discusses the use of animal hormones in the treatment of human diseases.

results.title: Endocrine glands
results.brief_description: By means of animation and microphotography, this film demonstrates the nature and function of the parathyroid, the pituitary, and the thyroid glands, and the pancreas. The use of insulin in treating diabetes is demonstrated, hyper and hypothyroidism are discussed, and stimulation of the mammary gland illustrated.
